explanation: The report is correct. add_response_entry calls strlen(header) without validating header for NULL; MHD_add_response_footer simply forwards its footer parameter as header to add_response_entry. Therefore a caller passing NULL for the footer (e.g. MHD_add_response_footer(some_response, NULL, "content")) would cause strlen(NULL) (undefined behavior / an out-of-bounds access of the object referenced by the pointer), violating MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (The agent’s example mistakenly wrote the call with parameters swapped, but the underlying issue stands.)
